text: The Voyager 1 spacecraft is the most distant human-made object from Earth, having traveled more than 14 billion miles since its launch in 1977.
The world’s largest producer of coffee is Brazil, which accounts for about one-third of the global production.
The Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world, standing at 828 meters (2,717 feet) tall.
The periodic table of elements was first created by Dmitri Mendeleev in 1869.
The first practical electrical circuit was created by Alessandro Volta in 1800 with his invention of the voltaic pile.
JavaScript was created in just 10 days by Brendan Eich in 1995.
The Eiffel Tower was initially intended to be a temporary installation, standing for only 20 years after the 1889 World’s Fair.
Graphene is one of the strongest materials known, with a tensile strength of 130 GPa, which is more than 100 times stronger than steel.
The first steam engine was developed by Thomas Newcomen in 1712 to pump water out of mines.
The Boeing 747, known as the 'Queen of the Skies,' was the first wide-body airplane ever produced and held the passenger capacity record for 37 years.
